page.title: 14ENTERTAINMENT & RECREATION
page.content: Bellerby has little to offer in the way of entertainment. The residents either make their own or travel further afield. In the village itself, the pub seems to be a popular meeting place for locals. The Memorial Hall has a full-size snooker table, which is used regularly and young people use the Parish field for games, mainly football. Domino and Whist Drives are also held in the Hall or at private homes during the winter months. Country and Western music is very popular in the Dales and regular 'evenings' are held at the Rugby Club in Leyburn and at the Falls Motel in Aysgarth. Many nearby villages have cricket and football teams,though not Bellerby itself. One local boy plays for Third Division, Darlington.
